intro: Turraea americana, commonly known as the American turraea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes plants known for their diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with a yellowish-green color. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Turraea americana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
